nodes.description: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi is reported to have died following a US military raid in north-west Syria.
nodes.support_text: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of the Islamic State, is reported to have died following a US military raid in north-west Syria.

nodes.description: Baghdadi is thought to have killed himself with a suicide vest as US special operations forces descended.
nodes.support_text: Baghdadi, whose real name is Ibrahim Awwad Ibrahim Ali Muhammad al-Badri al-Samarrai, is thought to have killed himself with a suicide vest as US special operations forces descended, according to media citing multiple government sources.

nodes.description: He was with two wives, who are also thought to have blown themselves up, and children which are believed to still be alive.
nodes.support_text: He was with two wives, who are also thought to have blown themselves up, and children which are believed to still be alive.

nodes.description: The raid, which began after midnight, targeted a compound in Barisha village in Idlib province near the Turkish border.
nodes.support_text: The raid, which began after midnight, targeted a compound in Barisha village in Idlib province near the Turkish border.

nodes.description: A video which is thought to have captured the raid shows helicopters and heavy clashes.
nodes.support_text: In a video which is thought to have captured the raid, helicopters and heavy clashes can be heard.

nodes.description: He was with two wives, who are also thought to have blown themselves up, and children which are believed to still be alive.
nodes.support_text: He was with two wives, who are also thought to have blown themselves up, and children which are believed to still be alive.

edges.support_text: Baghdadi, whose real name is Ibrahim Awwad Ibrahim Ali Muhammad al-Badri al-Samarrai, is thought to have killed himself with a suicide vest as US special operations forces descended, according to media citing multiple government sources.
The raid, which began after midnight, targeted a compound in Barisha village in Idlib province near the Turkish border.
In a video which is thought to have captured the raid, helicopters and heavy clashes can be heard.
